item.title: Three new routes have been announced by Air Asia
item.description: AirAsia is expanding its network in Indonesia and the Philippines with three new routes starting on March 27th. The airline will now offer flights from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to Pontianak, Indonesia, from Johor Bahru, Malaysia to Medan, Indonesia, and from Kota Kinabalu, Malaysia to Cebu, Philippines. The Indonesian routes will operate twice a week, while the Kota Kinabalu to Cebu route, operated by AirAsia Zest, will operate four times a week.

item.title: Air Asia provides a complimentary Penang travel guide
item.description: The low-cost carrier Air Asia is offering a complimentary travel guide for the island of Penang. Source: Air Asia e-DM. Penang, Malaysia is renowned for its distinctive cuisine, the UNESCO World Heritage site of George Town, and its Peranakan culture. The guide, designed to assist event planners organizing trips to Penang, encompasses the following: Food Art, Heritage, Crafts & Caf√©s Lifestyle & Nature Getting Around Calendar of Events The guide can be downloaded here.
